summary_reasoning: Explicitness: The report states key modeling inputs near the forecasts they inform, including DCF levers (cost of equity 7.5%, WACC 7.2%, long-run tax 19%, Stage II EBI growth 3.5%, projected shares) and business drivers (EPS growth near 4%, flat operating margins, Stelara decline, Caplyta ramp), and quantifies a 2025 tariff impact. Specificity: Assumptions are numeric with units and timeframes (multi-year revenue/EPS tables, $ impacts, 10-year horizon for Caplyta, Stage II/perpetuity year). Consistency: Narrative aligns broadly with the tables and valuation summary; model summaries reconcile across pages, with only minor phrasing tension (e.g., “flat” margins vs modestly rising modeled margins). Justification: Several drivers are justified qualitatively with pipeline data and industry context (tariffs, US pricing scenarios, tax-policy direction). However, some core valuation parameters (WACC, Stage II growth) lack source-based justification within the report. Sensitivity: There is partial quantified scenario context (tariff-induced margin headwind; potential US price convergence effect; tariff duration assumption), but no JNJ-specific valuation sensitivity tables or ranges for WACC/terminal growth. Overall, assumptions are explicit and specific with partial evidentiary support and limited scenario quantification.

assumptions_extracted.quote: We expect annual adjusted earnings per-share growth will average close to 4% during the next five years
We expect fairly flat operating margins over the next several years
Cost of Equity % 7.5 ... Weighted Average Cost of Capital % 7.2

assumptions_extracted.quote: We assume an over $3 billion decline in global Stelara sales in 2025.
annual sales for Caplyta of nearly $5 billion by the end of our 10-year explicit forecast period.
model base-case annual legal costs at 3% of non-GAAP net income
J&J expects a $400 million impact this year from confirmed tariffs, mostly on its medtech business

unjustified_parameters: Stage II EBI growth 3.5% without support
